name: Old-Fashioned Bread Pudding
author: Justin Shepheard
summary: This may be an old-fashioned bread pudding dessert, but good taste never goes out of style!
ingredients: 1 loaf white bread, torn into large chunks
directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Combine half-and-half, eggs, sugar, heavy cream, raisins, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a bowl; mix well
Arrange bread pieces on the bottom of the prepared pan
Place the baking pan into a larger pan; fill the larger pan with water halfway up the sides of the smaller pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 60 to 75 minutes
Meanwhile, melt butter in a small skillet over low heat
Pour into a small bowl; add confectioners' sugar and mix well
Remove bread pudding from the oven
Poke holes throughout using a butter knife
Pour butter sauce over the top
